poem:
### A Midwinter Moment

Bleak midwinter shadows  
whisper in the chill,  
yet a warmth stirs softly  
despite the ink's dark spill.

Amidst the raging flu  
and media wolves in cry,  
look up—feel the quiet  
of hope, unschooled by sky.

Pocket promises  
cloaked in humble light,  
casting seeds of dawn  
beyond the critic's night.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ignore Musk, ignore the critics – you’ll feel the benefit of Labour’s policies in your pocket before long | Polly Toynbee Look up, despite the bleak midwinter, the flu crisis and this dismal mood of political cynicism. Despite, too, the daily doom that pumps out of the most hostile media any new government ever faced, savaging whatever Labour does in extravagant language borrowed from Elon Musk. Good grief, the ever-rightward travelling Times just published a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
